messageBody:
kms_avexus wrote:

>I have an EJB that I would like to unit test from my IDE. In other
>words, I don't want to deploy the bean and it's home/remote/local
>interfaces. Not yet anyway. I wanted to first test the underlying
>code. Once that is working, then I'll test the remote invocation of
>this code.
>
>To do this I would have to instantiate the bean's class in some way,
>but as there is no contructor in an EJB (this is a stateless session
>bean, by the way). How could I go about doing this *without* having
>to add a temporary constructor just for the purposes of unit testing?
>
>

I generally use stateless session beans as a gateway to some other
object (POJO) which I can test outside of the EJB container. In other
words, the stateless session bean merely delegates to another object
which does have a constructor.

Mike
